tool.name: extractseq

parameter_list.switch_use__description: Both the switch and the value will be passed in the argument list. They will be separated by a space.
parameter_list.helptext: Sequence filename and optional format, or reference (input USA).

parameter_list.switch_use__description: Both the switch and the value will be passed in the argument list. They will be separated by a space.
parameter_list.helptext: Sequence set(s) filename and optional format (output USA).

parameter_list.switch_use__description: Both the switch and the value will be passed in the argument list. They will be separated by a space.
parameter_list.helptext:
Regions to extract. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are separated by any non-digit, non-alpha character.
Examples of region specifications are:
24-45, 56-78
1:45, 67=99;765..888
1,5,8,10,23,45,57,99

parameter_list.switch_use__description: Both the switch and the value will be passed in the argument list. They will be separated by a space.
parameter_list.helptext: If this is set true then each specified region is written out as a separate sequence. The name of the sequence is created from the name of the original sequence with the start and end positions of the range appended with underscore characters between them, eg: XYZ region 2 to 34 is written as: XYZ_2_34

tool.description: Allows you to specify one or more regions of a sequence to extract sub-sequences from to build up a contiguous resulting sequence.
